fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A picture caption was wrong to suggest that Loch Ròg on Lewis in the Outer Hebrides was among the beauty spots to which people would be permitted to drive from Wednesday. Scotland, unlike England, has not lifted restrictions on such non-essential travel (Battered tourism industry prepares to reopen amid fears of second virus wave, 11 May, page 17). • Other recently amended articles include: Ramadan TV dramas signal shift in Arab-Israeli relations Coronavirus shows British–EU solidarity vital, say ambassadors Virgin Money chief downplays impact of Branson bailout plea The day police bombed a city street: can scars of 1985 Move atrocity be healed? ‘Pub’ crawls and drive-by revelry: how UK is celebrating birthdays in lockdown ‘Colour allows us to understand in a deeper sense’: Hitler, Churchill and others in a new light Live and Let Die plays as Trump visits mask factory without a mask
